repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem: currently nvim_cmd can not handle plus flags correct.

Solution: add plus flags support.

Fix #21687
Fix #23782

comment_data.body:
these tests can be combined.

please look for similar opportunities in the other tests. avoid verbose, single-purpose tests when multiple related things can be covered in a single test.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -5205,4 +5205,172 @@ describe('API', function()
     api.nvim__redraw({ win = 0, range = { 0, -1 } })
     n.assert_alive()
   end)
+
+  describe('nvim_cmd with plus #flags', function()
+    it('handles +flags correctly', function()
+      -- Write a file for testing +flags
+      command(':call writefile(["Line 1", "Line 2", "Line 3"], "testfile")')
+
+      -- Test + command (go to the last line)
+      local result = exec_lua([[
+        vim.cmd(vim.api.nvim_parse_cmd('edit + testfile', {}))
+        return vim.fn.line('.')
+      ]])
+      eq(3, result)
+
+      -- Test +{num} command (go to line number)
+      result = exec_lua([[
+        vim.cmd(vim.api.nvim_parse_cmd('edit +3 testfile', {}))
+        return vim.fn.line('.')
+      ]])
+      eq(3, result)
+
+      -- Test +/{pattern} command (go to line with pattern)
+      result = exec_lua([[
+        vim.cmd(vim.api.nvim_parse_cmd('edit +/Line\\ 2 testfile', {}))
+        return vim.fn.line('.')
+      ]])
+      eq(2, result)
+
+      -- Test +{command} command (execute a command after opening the file)
+      result = exec_lua([[
+        vim.cmd(vim.api.nvim_parse_cmd('edit +set nomodifiable testfile', {}))
+        return vim.bo.modifiable
+      ]])
+      eq(false, result)
+
+      -- Clean up
+      os.remove('testfile')
+    end)
+
+    it('handles ++ff correctly', function()
+      exec_lua [[
+        vim.cmd(vim.api.nvim_parse_cmd('edit ++ff=mac test.txt', {}))
+      ]]
+      eq('mac', api.nvim_get_option_value('fileformat', {}))
+      eq('test.txt', fn.fnamemodify(api.nvim_buf_get_name(0), ':t'))
+    end)
+
+    it('handles ++fileformat correctly', function()

comment_data.body: Should this be done in `execute_cmd()` instead? That'll also allow keeping the two functions as static.
Would it be possible to move this code from here and `do_one_cmd` to `execute_cmd0` so there isn't any code duplication?
buffer command requires additional processing, so it is not appropriate to move it to execute_cmd0. oldtest `test_buffer` will failed.
can we use `api_err_invalid` or `VALIDATE_S` so that the invalid arg is mentioned in he message?
these it() cases can live in the existing describe() for nvim_cmd https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/91e116f3a6719e9dc7652f4e0a4b1760dfbf1af0/test/functional/api/vim_spec.lua#L4804
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -5507,4 +5507,156 @@ describe('API', function()
 
     n.assert_alive()
   end)
+
+  describe('nvim_cmd with plus flags', function()
+    it('handles +flags correctly', function()

comment_data.body: other than `.args`, are the +/++ things represented in any other field? like a "mods" field or something?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -5233,6 +5233,167 @@ describe('API', function()
       assert_alive()
       eq(false, exec_lua('return _G.success'))
     end)
+
+    it('handles +flags correctly', function()
+      -- Write a file for testing +flags
+      t.write_file('testfile', 'Line 1\nLine 2\nLine 3', false, false)
+
+      -- Test + command (go to the last line)
+      local result = exec_lua([[
+        local parsed = vim.api.nvim_parse_cmd('edit + testfile', {})
+        vim.cmd(parsed)
+        return { vim.fn.line('.'), parsed.args }
+      ]])
+      eq({ 3, { '+ testfile' } }, result)

comment_data.body: okay no test case used command modifier.. I have add a case for  mods and `parsed.cmd`
comment_data.diff_hunk:

       eq(false, exec_lua('return _G.success'))
     end)
+

+
+      -- Test + command (go to the last line)

comment_data.body: This does not actually set any `ea` field. So this is only validating? Was "++foo" already working?

comment_regular_data.body: This is a lot of new code. Is there any way to reuse it from existing codepaths? Or simplify it?
there has `getargopt` a static function can be used .  I've noticed it before. But I want to try to see if my current thinking is correct. It looks OK now. I'll try to simplify

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: feat(api): nvim_cmd supports plus ("+cmd", "++opt") flags
